intro.description: This cheat sheet demonstrates general chemistry (or, more strictly speaking, chemoinformatics) tasks you can do in Bioclipse. These are centered around handling molecular data files.

item.title: Open and Edit structures in 2D
item.description:
The JChemPaint editor (JCP) allows graphical viewing and editing of 2D diagrams of chemical structures in various formats. You can also draw new chemical structures from scratch, and save in CML and MDL molfile formats.
Double-click a molecule-file in the Navigator to open it in JCP or click "Perform" below to open a simple molecule. Use the toolbar for selecting the desired tool, and click in the editor to add/remove/move chemical structures.

item.title: Draw new structures in 2D from scratch
item.description: To start drawing a new molecule in 2D, use the top menu File > New... and select Molecule.

item.title: Open files with multiple structures
item.description:
Files with multiple structures (MDL SD files, and SMILES files) are handled by the Molecule Table Editor. Double-click a molecule-file in the Navigator to open it in JCP or click "Perform" below to open a generated list of molecules.
Try right-clicking in the MoleculesTable to see available options that can be performed on the molecules. For example you can select one or more molecules in the table and extract them to a separate file. Another option lets you calculate properties for all molecules in the file.

item.title: Create 2D and 3D coordinates
item.description: You can create 2D and 3D coordinates for molecules. Right click on the file in the Navigator and choose one of the Generate 2D or 3D options.

item.title: Smarts matching
item.description:
Show the view Smarts Matching from the menu Window > Show view > Other... and select SmartsMatching in the Cheminformatics folder.
The opened view has a local toolbar and a context menu (just right-click in the view) with several options that can be used to add/delete and run smarts matching.

item.title: Query and download proteins via web service
item.description: You can search and query a variety of external (EBI) databases using the Wizard at File > New > Cheminformatics > Query WSDbfetch at EBI.

item.title: Search and download chemical structures from PubChem
item.description: It is possible to search and download compounds from PubChem using teh Wizard at File > New > Cheminformatics > Get structures from PubChem.
